org.openimaj.ml.clustering.rforest

Class IntRandomForest

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.openimaj.ml.clustering.rforest.IntRandomForest
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Clusterer<int[][]>, Readable, ReadableASCII, ReadableBinary, ReadWriteable, Writeable, WriteableASCII, WriteableBinary, Assigner<int[]>, HardAssigner<int[],float[],IntFloatPair>, Clusters, SpatialClusterer<IntRandomForest,int[]>, SpatialClusters<int[]>

    @Reference(type=Article,
           author={"Frank Moosmann","Eric Nowak","Fr{\'e}d{\'e}ric Jurie"},
           title="Randomized Clustering Forests for Image Classification",
           year="2008",
           journal="IEEE PAMI",
           url="http://dx.doi.org/10.1109/TPAMI.2007.70822")
public class IntRandomForest
extends Object
implements SpatialClusters<int[]>, SpatialClusterer<IntRandomForest,int[]>, HardAssigner<int[],float[],IntFloatPair>
    An implementation of the RandomForest clustering algorithm proposed by Jurie et al.

    In this implementation the training phase is used to identify the limits of the data (for which a very small subset may be provided). Once this is known N decision trees are constructed each with M decisions (see RandomDecisionTree). In the clustering phase each feature projected is assigned a letter for each decision tree.

    Author:
    Jonathon Hare (jsh2@ecs.soton.ac.uk), Sina Samangooei (ss@ecs.soton.ac.uk)

    • Constructor Detail

      • IntRandomForest

        public IntRandomForest()
        Makes a default random forest with 32 trees each with 32 decisions. This results in 10^47 potential words.

      • IntRandomForest

        public IntRandomForest(int nTrees,
                       int nDecisions)
        Makes a random forest with nTrees each with nDecisions. This will result in nTrees ^ nDecisions potential words
        Parameters:
        nTrees - number of trees
        nDecisions - number of decisions per tree

      • assignLetters

        public org.openimaj.ml.clustering.rforest.IntRandomForest.Word[] assignLetters(int[][] data)
        Push each data point provided to a set of letters, i.e. a word. Each letter represents a set of decisions made in a single decision tree.
        Parameters:
        data -
        Returns:
        A word per data point

      • assignWord

        public org.openimaj.ml.clustering.rforest.IntRandomForest.Word assignWord(int[] data)
        Push a single data point to a set of letters, return the letters as word. This is achieved by pushing the data point down each decision tree. This returns the result of the n decisions made for that tree, this is a single letter. As a letter is seen for the first time, it is assigned a number. The letters are combined in sequence to construct a word.
        Parameters:
        data - to be projected
        Returns:
        A single word containing the letters containing the decisions made on each tree

      • assign

        public int assign(int[] data)
        Uses the assignWord(int[]) function to construct the word representing this data point. If this exact word has been seen before (i.e. these letters in this order) the same int is used. If not, a new int is assigned for this word.
        Specified by:
        assign in interface HardAssigner<int[],float[],IntFloatPair>
        Parameters:
        data - a data point to be clustered to a word
        Returns:
        a cluster centroid from a word

                           float[] distances)
        Description copied from interface: HardAssigner
        Assign data to clusters. The results are returned in the indices and distances arrays. The return arrays must have the same length as the data array.
        Specified by:

        Parameters:

        indices - the cluster index for each data point.
        distances - the distance to the closest cluster for each data point.
